reference: Programming models for facility dispersion: the p-dispersion and maxisum dispersion problems
math_formula:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Maximize} && D \\
&\text{Subject to} && \sum_{i \in N} x_i = p \\
& && D \leq d_{i,j} + M \cdot (1 - z_{i,j}) \quad \forall i, j \in N \\
& && z_{i,j} \leq x_i \quad \forall i, j \in N \\
& && z_{i,j} \leq x_j \quad \forall i, j \in N \\
& && z_{i,j} \geq x_i + x_j - 1 \quad \forall i, j \in N \\
& && x_i \in \{0, 1\} \quad \forall i \in N \\
& && z_{i,j} \in \{0, 1\} \quad \forall i, j \in N
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example: Suppose you are tasked with selecting 3 facilities from 10 candidate locations such that the minimum distance between any two selected facilities is maximized. The distances between the locations are known, and the goal is to ensure that the facilities are as dispersed as possible to avoid overlap or interference.
